com.rohitsood.urlybird
Class Start

java.lang.Object
  com.rohitsood.urlybird.Start
public final class Start
extends java.lang.Object

Starts the application. It is called by the user to start the gui and/or the server.
The following command line arguments are supported for mode:
(1) server
(2) alone

When no mode is specified, the default mode is used. The default mode starts the client in online mode. "alone" mode starts the application in offline mode, which completly bypasses all networking.
If an invalid mode is used the usage text is displayed.

Version:
1.1
Author:
Rohit Sood

Method Detail

launch

public static void launch(java.lang.String mode)
Uses the LauncherFactory to obtain and launch a specific Launcher. The mode is passed in as a string and the matching launcher is called which starts the application.

Parameters:
mode - the mode with which to launch the application

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Starting point of the application. Requires that a mode be passed in as a first parameter. Passing in no arguments results in starting the application in the default mode with networking. Invalid arguments results in usage being displayed on the console.

Parameters:
args - the arguments that decide which mode to launch the application in.
